citances.sentence: I am not persuaded that Tabcorp ought to be joined as a party to the proceeding. The test to be satisfied under paragraph (a) of O 6 r 8(1) of the Rules is well established --- whether any order made by the Court may have a direct effect on the rights and liabilities of the party seeking to be joined and not an effect that is merely indirect or consequential: News Limited at 523-525; Orrcon Operations Pty Ltd v Capital Steel & Pipe Pty Ltd (No 2) [2008] FCA 24 at [35] .

5 A person ought to have been joined under Order 6 rule 8(1)(a) if a judgment of the Court will have a direct effect on the rights and liabilities of that person and not one that is merely indirect or inconsequential: Orrcon Operations Pty Ltd v Capital Steel and Pipe Pty Ltd (No 2) [2008] FCA 24 at [35] . This rule is permissive only but should be liberally construed so that all parties to disputes relating to the one subject matter may be dealt with at the one time: John Cooke and Co Ltd v Commonwealth [1922] HCA 60 ; (1922) 31 CLR 394 at 411.
